items.content_html:
The specified non-same-page only behavior is not mentioned in the spec, and FF 134 and Chromium 132 do not behave that way.

Description

Drops a misleading part.

Motivation

The current documentation is wrong.

Additional details

To reproduce this behaviour, host this content and click on the "up" link at the bottom. Note how the browser scrolls upwards although it is on the same page.

This dummy PoC code was AI generated with DeepSeekR

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
    <head>
        <meta charset="UTF-8" />
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
        <title>Vegan Hotdogs</title>
        <style>
            body {
                font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
                margin: 0;
                padding: 0;
                background-color: #f5f5f5;
                max-width: 800px;
                margin: 0 auto;
            }

            .container {
                background-color: white;
                padding: 20px;
                box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
            }

            header {
                background-color: #4caf50;
                color: white;
                text-align: center;
                padding: 20px 0;
            }

            .main-content {
                margin: 20px 0;
            }

            .main-content p {
                line-height: 1.6;
                color: #333;
            }

            footer {
                background-color: #45a049;
                color: white;
                text-align: center;
                padding: 15px 0;
                margin-top: 20px;
            }

            h1,
            h2 {
                margin-bottom: 15px;
            }
        </style>
    </head>
    <body>
        <div class="container">
            <header>

                    texture of traditional hotdogs without any animal products.

items.content_html: FF132 default accept header was changed in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1917177. The value was updated in docs in #37836, but this adds a release note.
items.title: FF132 Document Accept Header value changed

items.content_html:
FF135 re-enables support for the JSON.parse source text access proposal in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1934622

This was previously added/removed in FF132. This reverts that change by removing the experimental feature and adding the (same) release note.

Related docs work can be tracked in #37514
items.title: FF135 Relnote: json.parse() with source

items.content_html: the yahoo stuff was from 2010.
items.title: Update see also links (learn web perf)

items.content_html:
See whatwg/html#7867

Description

Add a new section to help developers avoid the special h1 in section default styling.

Motivation

We're trying to remove the special default styling in the spec and in Firefox. Devtools will have a warning, but the warning should have a link to help developers know what to do and why. My plan is to link to this new section.

Additional details

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1937568

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Suggest specifying font-size and margin-block on h1

items.content_html:
Description

Most of the work to remove binary assets is done in the HTTP section.
This PR adds some hints about using SVG for diagrams, where to put them, and how they're included in content.

Motivation

Closing out the discussion with a recommendation for using SVG in shared assets.
items.title: feat: add info about where to put SVG assets

items.content_html:
Description

Adds a note about the supported path values in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari for web_accessible_resources.matches.

Related issues and pull requests

Addresses the dev-docs-needed request for Bug 1833415 web_accessible_resources[].matches should only accept patterns with "/*"
items.title: Bug-1833415 web_accessible_resources.matches clarification

items.content_html:
This change updates the page for the keypress event to match actual behavior in browsers ‚Äî by changing the page to state that the event fires when the Enter key is pressed ‚Äî not only when a key that produces a character value is pressed.

  • w3c/uievents#183 (comment)
  • w3c/uievents#266 (comment)
  • w3c/uievents#392

Otherwise, without this change, the information on the keypress page incorrectly doesn‚Äôt match actual browser behavior ‚Äî in that the page states that the keypress event fires only when a key that produces a character value are pressed, while in fact browsers also fire the event when the Enter key is pressed.
items.title: Document that the Enter key causes the ‚Äúkeypress‚Äù event to fire

items.title: test: modify the document which references the images in other folders

items.content_html:
Docs for the JS Self-Profiling API.

  • I've included a page for samplebufferfull which is mentioned in the spec but not defined, and which doesn't have a BCD entry yet.
  • in my experiments I often see samples which only have a timestamp and no stack ID. I believe that these are when the browser is doing some other work that isn't directly executing the program, like GC. Is that right? I should probably say something about this.
  • this API is protected using Document Policy which AFAIK is not documented on MDN. I haven't done that as part of this PR but we should. I think there is an issue somewhere to document it but I can't find it in mdn/content.
items.title: Add docs for JS self-profiling API

items.content_html:

Add to note to the managed storage page that changes to the policy manifest are only loaded into manage storage when the browser restart.

  • confirm status and behavior of onChange

Related issues and pull requests

items.title: Bug-1685965 managed storage policy update clarification

items.content_html:
Description

In preparation for getting rid of the /web/guide dir, these resources need a new home.
There is no real content change, this is moving docs only, with one addition for sidebars.

Motivation

IA improvements & maintenance
Eventually, the guide dir will be gone, but this is blocked on #37784 so I'm taking care of the other pages first.

  • revert reordering of sidebars from fmt-sidebars command
